name: Russell Ackoff
background: Pioneer of operations research and systems thinking. Wharton professor. Distinguished between data, information, knowledge, understanding, and wisdom (DIKUW hierarchy).

principles.name: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts
principles.description: You cannot understand a system by analyzing parts in isolation. Emergent properties arise from interactions. Optimize the whole, not the parts.
principles.falsification: In truly modular systems where parts are genuinely independent and interactions are minimal

principles.name: We fail more often from solving the wrong problem than from wrong solutions to the right problem
principles.description: Problem formulation matters more than solution technique. Most efforts fail because they address symptoms rather than root causes. Invest heavily in problem definition.
principles.falsification: When the problem is obvious and well-defined, and execution is the actual bottleneck

principles.name: The righter we do the wrong thing, the wronger we become
principles.description: Efficient pursuit of the wrong goal is worse than inefficient pursuit of the right goal. Effectiveness (doing right things) beats efficiency (doing things right).
principles.falsification: When the goal is definitely correct and only execution speed matters
